content:
Yes, there are many modern musicians who incorporate traditional African tribal instruments into their music today to create a unique and contemporary sound. Some examples of modern African musicians who use these traditional instruments include:

1. Youssou N'Dour - Senegalese singer and songwriter who uses the kora, djembe, and other instruments in his music.

2. Baaba Maal - Senegalese musician who plays the kora, talking drum, and other traditional instruments.

3. Angelique Kidjo - Benin singer who incorporates the sound of the balafon, djembe, and other African instruments into her music.

4. Amadou & Mariam - Malian husband-and-wife duo who incorporate the ngoni and other African instruments into their music.

5. Salif Keita - Malian musician who uses the balafon, kora, and other traditional instruments in his music.

These are just a few examples of modern musicians who have embraced African tribal instruments in their music.
